Theatre in Colonial South, Southeast, and East Asia HKU

About

This website features students’ original pieces of historical writing on histories of colonial South, Southeast, and East Asian theatre during the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries.

See more…


Asia (1828 Map of Asia) by F. D. Zachary is in the Public Domain

Student Works

  • Missing Footprints: British musical comedy in colonial Hong Kong

  • English Theatre as a Colonial Project in Hong Kong

  • Theatre and Women’s Visibility in Nineteenth Century India

  • Australian Itinerant Theatres as Colonial Cultural Assimilation

  • The Unrecognisable Bard: Amalgamating the Colonizer and the Colonized Through Theatre

See more…

Resources

Delpher - Digitised Dutch East Indies newspapers, books, and magazines

NewspaperSG - An online digital archive of Singapore’s newspapers

Digitised HK Newspapers - Digitised archive of old HK newspapers

Asiatic Society of Mumbai - Digitised books, newspapers, manuscripts, maps, journals, government publications and reports from colonial India.

ProQuest Historical Newspaper (Chinese Newspaper / SCMP) - Expansive digital archive of historical newspapers

HKUL Special Collections (Digital)
